Lightcurve Functions¶

Function to generate lightcurves using different methods.

lightcurve.with_depth(depth, transit_duration=0.01, num_points=1000)¶
Parameters:

  • depth – float Depth of the transit (fractional decrease in flux)

  • transit_duration – float Duration of the transit in days.

  • num_points – int Number of data points in the lightcurve.

Returns:

Two arrays representing time and flux as the dataset for lightcurve

Return type:

tuple

lightcurve.with_noise(period, duration, depth, t_total, t_resolution=1000, noise_level=0.01)¶
Parameters:

  • period – float orbital period of the exoplanet (in days)

  • duration – float duration of the planetary transit (in hours)

  • depth – float depth of the transit (fractional decrease in flux)

  • t_total – float total duration of the observation (in days).

  • t_resolution – int number of time points in the light curve.

  • noise_level – float level of Gaussian noise to add to the light curve.

Returns:

Two arrays representing time and flux as the dataset for lightcurve

Return type:

tuple

lightcurve.with_radius(R_planet, R_star, transit_duration=0.01, num_points=1000)¶
Parameters:

  • R_planet (float) – Radius of the planet in Jupiter radii.

  • R_star (float) – Radius of the star in Solar radii.

  • transit_duration (float) – Duration of the transit in days.

  • num_points (int) – Number of data points in the lightcurve.

Returns:

Two arrays representing time and flux as the dataset for lightcurve

Return type:

tuple
